semantic_title: Z Codes That May Only be Principal/First-Listed Diagnosis - Sequencing Requirements
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 21. Factors Influencing Health Status and Contact with Health Services (Z00-Z99) > c. Categories of Z Codes > 15. Z Codes That May Only be Principal/First-Listed Diagnosis

content.full_text: The following Z codes/subcategories/categories may only be reported as the principal/first-listed diagnosis, except when there are multiple encounters on the same day and the medical records for the encounters are combined: Z00 Encounter for general examination without complaint, suspected or reported diagnosis Except: Z00.6, Z01 Encounter for other special examination without complaint, suspected or reported diagnosis, Z02 Encounter for administrative examination, Z04 Encounter for examination and observation for other reasons, Z33.2 Encounter for elective termination of pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 105, L90-L99)
content.summary: Specific Z codes that must be used as principal or first-listed diagnosis with exception for combined same-day encounters (Evidence: pg no: 105, L90-L99)
